intro: Gymnanthes glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular gymnanthes, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by leaf-like bracts. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Gymnanthes glandulosa is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
